page.title: 02WETHERBY DOMESDAY PROJECT
page.content: The two Domesday Blocks for Wetherby were surveyed during the summer term of 1985 by local schools. Although the {High School}coordinated the work it was very much a joint venture.{St. {James Primary School}were the first to start, they concentrated on the area East of the old A1 (North Street) counting amenities and visiting companies on the industrial estate. {Crossley Street Primary School surveyed the town to the West of the old A1, visiting the Market and Council offices. The High School used sixth form students to survey the rural areas to the East and West and to investigate various local issues. {Sicklinghall School}provided the page on their village hall. One of the major benefits of the project has been to enable the schools to work more closely with each other.
